Posts.Content: Thanks Chuck for your quick response. My father's age is 68. Also, was curious to know if we can know if it is in early stage.....
Posts.Title: Biopsy for Prostate and PSA report shows some bad things.

Posts.Content: Hi MF, Thanks for your good update. My father underwent surgery and at that time he had PSA test and it was found ,7.88. We have not done it before. He is in India. I have few doubts, biopsy report suggests perineural invasion. Gleason score is 6. Does it signifies there is some eye raising things within prostate ( maybe cancer) ? Is there error in biopsy report?
Posts.Title: Biopsy for Prostate and PSA report shows some bad things.

Posts.Content: Thanks Chuck for your quick response. My father's age is 68. Also, was curious to know if we can know if it is in early stage.....
Posts.Title: Biopsy for Prostate and PSA report shows some bad things.

Posts.Content: Hi Chuck, Is it fine if father is conducting all the tests and treatment after 1-2 months from the surgery. Is there any alternate medicines that can cure this......
Posts.Title: Biopsy for Prostate and PSA report shows some bad things.

Posts.Content: Hi All, Recently, My father underwent TURP surgery. Biopsy was done and Biopsy has the following things 1. Prostatic Needle Biopsy 2.Invasive Prostatic Adenocarcinoma moderately differentiated ( Combined Gleason score -3A+3B=6/10) Tumor Quantification ========= Total no of cores=9 No of cores involved by tumor=8 percentage area involved by tumor 40-50% Perineural Invasion is present periprostatic fat invasion is not seen Lymphvascular invasion is not seen PSA report says 7.88 Please suggest me what steps have to be taken. I am worried on this. ====================
Posts.Title: Biopsy for Prostate and PSA report shows some bad things.

Posts.Content: Hi All, Recently, My father underwent TURP surgery. Biopsy was done and Biopsy has the following things 1. Prostatic Needle Biopsy 2.Invasive Prostatic Adenocarcinoma moderately differentiated ( Combined Gleason score -3A+3B=6/10) Tumor Quantification ========= Total no of cores=9 No of cores involved by tumor=8 percentage area involved by tumor 40-50% Perineural Invasion is present periprostatic fat invasion is not seen Lymphvascular invasion is not seen PSA report says 7.88 Please suggest me what steps have to be taken. I am worried on this. ====================
Posts.Title: Biopsy for Prostate and PSA report shows some bad things.

Posts.Content: Thanks Chuck for your quick and informative response. Some of the other things in Biopsy are ============ TURP CHIPS : Benign Hyperplasia of prostate with focal high grade prostatic interaepithelial Neoplasia ============ Microscopic description ============ section from prostatic tissue fragments comprising glands lined by double layered epithelial cells. Some glands are cystically dilated containing proteinaceous sections in the lumen. Stroma is composed of smooth muscle bundles which at places form microleimyomatous nodules. Few glands show for high grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia characterized by elongated nuclie and prominent nucleoli. ======================== The story is like this: Father had been feeling difficulty at urination for longer time. He did not disclose this. When examined doctor said that he has to undergo TURP. Recently ( 28th Jan) he had the surgery and biopsy report reveals this. As you said correctly, cancer might be there from longer period. Is it harmful that he underwent TURP surgery..... It is great to listen from you.
